file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 57-42-00-04 - WING LEADING EDGE II - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL WING LEADING EDGE II - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install wing leading edges II. B. These procedures are applicable to LH and RH wing leading edges II. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 57-42-00-000-801-A LEADING EDGE II - REMOVAL ALL 57-42-00-400-801-A LEADING EDGE II - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 57-42-00 Page 1 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 57-42-00-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. LEADING EDGE II - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove wing leading edge II. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION SRM 51-20-01 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 512 LH wing 612 RH wing D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task LH or RH wing 1 Helps the other technician LH or RH wing I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, open the WING circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the splices (6) and (9) and gaskets seal (11). For this, remove the screws (5) (52 positions) and (8) (64 positions). (2) Disconnect the end of the piccolo tube of leading edge II (7) from the end of the piccolo tube of leading edge I (10) as follows: EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 57-42-00 Page 2 of 8 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL CAUTION: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU SLIDE THE COUPLING (1) ON THE PICCOLO TUBE TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE SEAL DEVICE IN THE COUPLING AND TO THE PICCOLO TUBE ENDS. (a) Loosen the clamp of the coupling (1) (refer to DET. D) and push to slide it on the piccolo tube of leading edge I (10). NOTE: The coupling should be completely moved off the piccolo tube to prevent damage to the end tube. (3) Disconnect the end of the piccolo tube of leading edge II (7) from the end of the piccolo tube of leading edge III (4) as follows: CAUTION: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU SLIDE THE COUPLING (3) ON THE PICCOLO TUBE TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE SEAL DEVICE IN THE COUPLING AND TO THE PICCOLO TUBE ENDS. (a) Loosen the clamp of the coupling (3) (refer to DET. D) and push to slide it on the piccolo tube of leading edge II (7). NOTE: The coupling should be completely moved off the piccolo tube to prevent damage to the end tube. CAUTION: REMOVE THE SCREWS FROM LOWER AND UPPER POSITIONS. IF YOU DO NOT OBEY THIS PRECAUTION, DAMAGE TO THE SPAR AND LEADING EDGE CAN OCCUR. (4) Remove the screws (2) (148 positions). (5) Carefully pull leading edge II (7) and remove it from the wing. (6) Remove the old aerodynamic sealant and prepare the surface (SRM 51-20-01). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 57-42-00 Page 3 of 8 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Leading Edge II - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B A ZONE 3. COUPLING 612 2. SCREW (148) D 1. COUPLING A D ZONE 512 4. LEADING EDGE III 5. SCREW (52) 7. LEADING EDGE II 6. SPLICE 8. SCREW (64) 11. GASKET SEAL 10. LEADING EDGE I 9. SPLICE DET. A (TYP.) 11. GASKET SEAL 1 DET. E C SEALANT C DET. B (TYP.) PICCOLO TUBE (REF.) CLAMP 5. SPLICE COUPLING (REF) E E GUIDE PIN SLOT DET. C DET. D (TYP.) SEALANT (TYP.) DRAIN (DO NOT APPLY 1 SEALANT) AERODYNAMIC SEALING EM145AMM570037E.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 57-42-00 Page 4 of 8 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Screws Tightening Sequence Figure 402 1 2 3 1 1 1 A 2 3 3 2 AND ON VIEW A 1 FIRST INSTALL THE SCREWS ON THESE CORNERS 2 SECONDLY INSTALL THE SCREWS ON THE CENTER POSITION 3 INSTALL THE REMAINING SCREWS FROM THE CENTER POSITION TO THE LEADING EDGE BORDERS, ALTERNATING BETWEEN THE UPPER RIVETING AND THE LOWER RIVETING ROW. REFER TO VIEW A FOR TIGHTENING SEQUENCE EM145AMM570121A.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 57-42-00 Page 5 of 8 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 57-42-00-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. LEADING EDGE II - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install wing leading edge II. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 30-00-00-700-802-A/500 ANTI-ICING SYSTEM - OPERATIONAL TEST SRM 51-20-01 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 512 LH wing 612 RH wing D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MEP 09-083 Sealant, PR 2050 B-1/2 AR MEP 09-045 Sealant, RTV 157 AR MEP 09-075 Corrosion-Inhibiting Compound (COR-BAN 27L) AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task LH or RH wing 1 Helps the other technician LH or RH wing I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put leading edge II (7) on the spar of the wing. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 57-42-00 Page 6 of 8 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Install the screws (2) (148 positions) and tighten them in an each-second sequence to attach leading edge II (7). Refer to Figure 402. (3) Connect the end of the piccolo tube of leading edge II (7) to the end of the piccolo tube of leading edge III (4) as follows: CAUTION: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU MOVE THE COUPLING (3) ON THE PICCOLO TUBE TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE SEAL DEVICE IN THE COUPLING AND TO THE PICCOLO TUBE ENDS. (a) Push the coupling (3) and connect it to the piccolo tube of leading edge III (4). NOTE: Make sure that the guide pin of the piccolo tube is correctly engaged on the slot of the coupling (3) (refer to DET. D). (b) Tighten the clamp of the coupling (3). (4) Connect the end of the piccolo tube of leading edge II (7) to the end of the piccolo tube of leading edge I (10) as follows: CAUTION: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU MOVE THE COUPLING (1) ON THE PICCOLO TUBE TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE SEAL DEVICE IN THE COUPLING AND TO THE PICCOLO TUBE ENDS. (a) Push the coupling (1) and connect it to the piccolo tube of leading edge II (7). NOTE: Make sure that the guide pin of the piccolo tube is correctly engaged on the slot of the coupling (1) (refer to DET. D). (b) Tighten the clamp of the coupling (1). (5) Install the gaskets seal (11) in the region of the splices (6) and (9). WARNING: COR-BAN 27L CORROSION-INHIBITING COMPOUNDS ARE TOXIC TO SKIN, EYES, AND RESPIRATORY TRACT. USE GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE GLOVES. USE ONLY IN WELL VENTILATED AREAS. OBEY THE MANUFACTURES' HEALTH AND SAFETY INSTRUCTIONS. (6) Apply COR-BAN 27L to the screws (5) (52 positions) and (8) (64 positions) of the splice. (7) Install the splices (6) and (9) with the screws (5) and (8). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) There are different methods to do the aerodynamic sealing along the gaps between the leading edge and the wing (refer to DET. B). Use the applicable procedure as necessary. (a) Full sealant-curing time: 1 Apply sealant PR 2050 B-1/2. NOTE: The sealant curing time will change with the environmental conditions (SRM 51-20-01). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 57-42-00 Page 7 of 8 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (b) Acceleration of sealant curing time with heating: 1 Apply sealant PR 2050 B-1/2. 2 Wait for one hour after the sealant is applied. CAUTION: THE TEMPERATURE MUST NOT BE HIGHER THAN 55ÃÂ°C (131ÃÂ°F). 3 Heat the area which received the sealant. NOTE: Sealant curing time versus temperature rate changes as shown in the Sealant Specification Table (SRM 51-20-01). (c) Application of aluminum tape after tack-free time. NOTE: This procedure must only be done when a faster aircraft clearance is necessary. 1 Apply sealant PR 2050 B-1/2. 2 You can accelerate the sealant curing time as written in paragraph (b). 3 After the sealant is tack-free, apply aluminum tape. NOTE: You can operate the aircraft immediately after the aluminum tape application. 4 Remove the aluminum tape after 150 hours. (d) Application of polyethylene film and aluminum tape. 1 Apply sealant PR 2050 B-1/2. 2 Apply a polyethylene film on the sealant. 3 Apply the aluminum tape. NOTE: You can operate the aircraft immediately after the aluminum tape is applied. 4 Remove the aluminum tape after 10 days. CAUTION: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU APPLY SEALANT ALONG THE CONTOUR OF THE SPLICES (6) AND (9) TO PREVENT BLOCKAGE OF THEIR DRAIN HOLES. (2) Apply aerodynamic sealant RTV 157 (SRM 51-20-01) along the gaps between the splice (6) and (9) and the leading edges (refer to DET. C). (3) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, close the WING circuit breaker and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from it. (4) Do an operational check of the Wing Thermal Anti-Icing System ( AMM TASK 30-00-00-700-802-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 57-42-00 Page 8 of 8 Rev 55 - Oct 29/18 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
